Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Tailored Negative Pressure Wound Therapy in Patients with Microangiopathy

Participants.evidence: Participants included obese patients with type 2 diabetes and arterial hypertension who developed severe SSIs post-abdominal surgery.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received tailored NPWT based on the ANSWER score, while the control group received standard NPWT at -125 mmHg.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the effectiveness of tailored negative pressure wound therapy (NPWT) settings to optimize wound healing in this subgroup.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the wound healing rate over 90 days.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not feasible due to the nature of the intervention.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 60 participants were randomised, with 30 in each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis was conducted on an intention-to-treat basis.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were mild and occurred in 2/30 (7%) of the intervention group and 3/30 (10%) of the control group.

Funding.evidence: Funding: Supported by the National Institute of Health.
